com.immortallabs.cardboard.game
Class Timer

java.lang.Object
  java.util.Observable
      com.immortallabs.cardboard.game.Timer

public class Timer
extends java.util.Observable

Counts the number of seconds that have passed continuously. Timer also will handle counting down a specified number of seconds and can have a concurrent buzz-in count down timer.

Operations:
  • Timer can return the number of seconds passed in the game.
  • Timer can be paused/resumed.
  • Timer class can count down a specified number of seconds.
  • Timer class can count the number of seconds that have passed.
  • Timer class will handle user buzzing in.
  • Time can be checked for expiration.

Version:
1.3, 01/30/09
Author:
Justin C. Appler, Sky Eckstrom, Immortal Labs CSC309 W09
Version History:
- 01/30/09 1.3 Added an isExpired check
Timer notifies observers on all changes now
- 01/12/09 1.2 jappler took ownership of class, updated version
- 12/04/08 1.1 Added Version History & Pseudocode
- 11/30/08 1.0 Inital Class Skeleton

          Represents the different possible timer limits

Constructor Summary
Timer()
          Instantiates a new timer with a zero count that begins immediately
 
Method Summary
 void buzzDone()
          Ends the count down buzz in timer and switches the returned seconds to the overall count up timer.
 void buzzIn()
          Starts a count down with fifteen seconds that runs concurrent to the on going count up.
 Natural getSeconds()
          Returns the current number of seconds on the timer, if in count up mode the timer will return the number of seconds the timer has been running.
 boolean isExpired()
          Checks to see if the last update was an expiration.
 void pause()
          Pauses the timer.
 void resume()
          Resumes the timer at it's previous count
 void startCountdown(Timer.TIMER_LIMIT limit)
          Switches the timer to count-down mode.
 void startCountUp()
          Restarts the counter at zero and resumes the timer if it's paused.

Constant Field Values

private int seconds

targetSeconds

private int targetSeconds
Holds the target seconds we're counting down to. If targetSeconds is zero we're not counting down to anything.

Constructor Detail

Timer

public Timer()
Instantiates a new timer with a zero count that begins immediately

Method Detail

buzzDone

public void buzzDone()
Ends the count down buzz in timer and switches the returned seconds to the overall count up timer.

buzzIn

public void buzzIn()
Starts a count down with fifteen seconds that runs concurrent to the on going count up.

getSeconds

public Natural getSeconds()
Returns the current number of seconds on the timer, if in count up mode the timer will return the number of seconds the timer has been running. If in count down mode the timer will return the number of seconds remaining.

Returns:
the current number of seconds on the timer

isExpired

public boolean isExpired()
Checks to see if the last update was an expiration.

Returns:
true if the last update was an expiration, false otherwise

pause

public void pause()
Pauses the timer.

resume

public void resume()
Resumes the timer at it's previous count

startCountdown

public void startCountdown(Timer.TIMER_LIMIT limit)
Switches the timer to count-down mode.

Parameters:
limit - the number of seconds to count down.

startCountUp

public void startCountUp()
Restarts the counter at zero and resumes the timer if it's paused.
